intro: Rudbeckia auriculata, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and large, showy yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features palmately divided, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. Rudbeckia auriculata thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in swamps, marshes, and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for wetland restoration and ornamental gardening.
